edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_game

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_game.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is meant to call important methods, keep stats, and handle all, if not most interactions. It will be called by UI class.
    Author:
    Phil Sloan, Dale Kim, Hagop B.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        This is the default constructor. It will initialize a game with 9 rooms, place the player in the bottom left corner, and spawn 6 ninjas randomly across the board. It will also create power ups randomly.

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(java.lang.Object readObject)
        This constructor allows an object to be passed into the game engine and will load it accordingly.
        Parameters:
        readObject -

    • Method Detail

      • initializeRooms

        public void initializeRooms()
        This method will initialize the 9 rooms and give them the appropriate location information. Also, this method will use a random number generator to randomly place the breifcase in one of the rooms.

      • initializeNinjas

        public void initializeNinjas()
        This method initializes the ninjas onto the playing map. They will use a random number to assign their initial positions.

      • initializePowerUps

        public void initializePowerUps()
        This method will create and place the three powerUp objects randomly on the grid.

      • getGrid

        public Grid getGrid()
        This method returns a Grid object used by the GameEngine
        Returns:
        Grid

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        This method returns the player object in use by the GameEngine.
        Returns:

      • getNinja

        public Ninja getNinja(int i)
        This returns a ninja object from the array of ninjas in use by the game engine. If the number is out of range it will produce an ArrayIndexOutofBounds exception.
        Parameters:
        i - The number of the ninja to be accessed (should be 0-5)
        Returns:
        The ninja object at the index location.

      • getPowerUp

        public PowerUp getPowerUp(int i)
        This returns a powerUp object from the array of powerUps in use by the game engine. If the number is out of range it will produce an ArrayIndexOutofBounds exception.
        Parameters:
        i - The number of the powerUp to be accessed (should be 0-2)
        Returns:
        The powerUp object at the specified index.

      • getRoom

        public Room getRoom(int i)
        This returns a room object from the array of rooms in use by the game engine. If the number is out of range it will produce an ArrayIndexOutofBounds exception.
        Parameters:
        i - The number of the room to be accessed (should be 0-8)
        Returns:
        The room object at the specified index.

      • getWin

        public boolean getWin()
        This method returns true if the game has been won. It returns false if the win conditions have not been met.
        Returns:
        The boolean win value.

      • getLivesRemaining

        public int getLivesRemaining()
        This method returns the number of lives the player currently has remaining.
        Returns:
        An int of the remaining lives.

      • radarOnCheck

        public void radarOnCheck()
        hmm is this method still needed? I don't know.

      • setWin

        public static void setWin()
        This method will change the win state to true, if it is false.

      • lookDir

        public boolean lookDir(java.lang.String direction)
        This method will change the look diretion of the player using Player.lookDir(String, int).
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction that the player will now be looking
      • MovableObject.UP
      • MovableObject.DOWN
      • MovableObject.RIGHT
      • MovableObject.LEFT
        • Returns:
        Returns true if the breifcase was found and sets the win state to true.

      • MovePlayer

        public boolean MovePlayer(java.lang.String direction)
        This method will move the player in the specified direction, using MovableObject.MoveObject(String, int) The values are defined by the constants in MovableObject :
      • MovableObject.UP
      • MovableObject.DOWN
      • MovableObject.RIGHT
      • MovableObject.LEFT
Parameters:
direction -
Returns:
Returns true if the move was a success.

  • checkForKill

    public void checkForKill()
    This method will check to see if a player is next to ninja. It is called at the begining of the game loop and at the end. It has no return, but will kill the player if it is next to a ninja. Also, the method kills a ninja if it was unlucky enough to wander into the spawn square. Upon spawn, this method also makes the player invincible for a turn so that it won't perpetually die should a ninja be right next to the spawn. TODO: probably should make sure there aren't like two ninjas surrounding the spawn so the player can get out??

  • moveNinjas

    public void moveNinjas()
    This method will move the ninjas in one of 4 random directions. It does this with a random number between 1-4 that corresponds to the direction to be moved.
    See Also:
    MovableObject.MoveObject(String Direction, int type)

  • refreshPowerUps

    protected static void refreshPowerUps()
    This method is called to make sure that the powerups remain visible once a ninja object passes over them on the grid.

  • printGrid

    public java.lang.String printGrid(boolean debug)
    This method calls the Object.toString() method in order to pass a string to the UI.
    Returns:
    the formatted string created of the grid objects.

  • clrScrn

    public void clrScrn()
    This method will call the console command to clear the text on a console on a particular OS

  • shoot

    public boolean shoot()
    This method will shoot in the direction the player is currently looking, if he currently has ammo. If a ninja stands in the way, it will die, using the Ninja.die() method.
    Returns:
    This method returns true if the "bullet" hits an object.

  • resetEngine

    public void resetEngine()
    This method resets the engine to the state at the beginning of the game.
